predefinedQuestions.text: Is there literature supporting the rationale of gene-disease association?
What is the druggability of the target?
What is the competition status of the target? Are there advanced clinical programs?
For the target, what is the gene/protein expression level in the relevant tissue?

ui.landscapeDescription:
The data landscape contains datasets from the following data sources.

**Basic datasets**

- [Cancer Cell Line Encyclopedia (CCLE)](https://sites.broadinstitute.org/ccle/) for sample annotation, gene expression, mutation, and copy number data.
- [The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA)](https://cancergenome.nih.gov) for smple annotation, gene expression, mutation, and copy number data.
- [Gene Annotation](https://oct2016.archive.ensembl.org) based on Ensembl 86.

**Depletion Screen Data**

- [Project DRIVE](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cell.2017.07.005) for RNAi depletion screen data (RSA and ATARiS) from *McDonald III, E. R. et. al. Project DRIVE: A Compendium of Cancer Dependencies and Synthetic Lethal Relationships Uncovered by (2017)*.
- [Avana CERES](https://doi.org/10.1038/ng.3984) for CRISPR-Cas9 depletion screen data from *Meyers, R. M. et. al. Computational correction of copy number effect improves specificity of CRISPRCas9 essentiality screens in cancer cells. Nature Genetics 49, 17791784 (2017)*.

banner.message: The January release brings significant improvements to search functionality and scatter plot visualization in Ordino. [Check out the release notes](/pages/news/release-january-2025) for more information.
